title: Relative motion -ball thrown on accelerating train

content.question: Students <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> are standing inside a train that is accelerating to the right with a magnitude of <math alttext="2 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Student A throws a ball to the left toward Student <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> with a horizontal velocity of magnitude <math alttext="4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> relative to the train. At the instant the ball leaves Student <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>â€™s hand, the speed of the train relative to the ground is <math alttext="10 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> to the right. The ball takes <math alttext="0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>5</mn></math> second to reach Student <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>. Immediately before the ball reaches Student <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, the horizontal speed of the ball relative to the ground is

choices.label: <math alttext="7 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
